conclusion: Analyze the behavior of ions in the velocity selector, magnetic analyzer, and deflection system.
Velocity selector uses electric and magnetic fields to select ions with specific velocity.
Electric field E is directed vertically upwards, magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Electric force equals magnetic force for ions to pass through the velocity selector without deflection: qE = qvB.
Solve for ion velocity: v = E/B.
Magnetic analyzer selects ions based on charge-to-mass ratio.
Radius of circular path determined by balance between centripetal force and magnetic force: mv^2/R = qvB.
Solve for charge-to-mass ratio: q/m = v/(BR).
Magnetic analyzer has quarter-circular ring with inner and outer radii R1 and R2.
Radius R must be within limits R1 ≤ R ≤ R2 for ions to pass through apertures at M and N.
Deflection system uses electric and magnetic fields to deflect ions onto wafer.
Electric field E and magnetic field B in deflection system are directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Deflection angle caused by electric field: α_E = qEL/(mv^2).
Deflection angle caused by magnetic field: α_B = qBL/(mv).
Total deflection angle α is approximately the sum of the two angles: α ≈ α_E + α_B.
Velocity of ions after passing through the velocity selector: v = E/B.
Charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by the magnetic analyzer: q/m = v/(BR).
